meanings.definition: A physical or mental feature that is regarded as indicating a condition of disease.
meanings.sent1: Her symptoms of a headache and fever led the doctor to diagnose the flu.
meanings.sent2: The cough and runny nose are common symptoms of a cold.
meanings.sent3: His constant yawning in class became a humorous symptom of his lack of sleep.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathering in the sky were symptoms of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder and bright lightning were vivid symptoms of the storm's intensity.

meanings.definition: A sign or indication of something.
meanings.sent1: The sudden drop in temperature was a symptom of the changing seasons.
meanings.sent2: The closed sign on the door was a clear symptom that the store was not open.
meanings.sent3: His habit of tapping his foot was a quirky symptom of his impatience.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam was a symptom of the city's rush hour chaos.
meanings.sent5: The colorful leaves falling from the trees were a beautiful symptom of autumn.
